documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
Privacy Policy Last Update: 23 September 2022 1.
General Notes Unless otherwise indicated, this privacy policy applies for both the Territorial.io app and for the website (www.territorial.io).
In this policy, "Territorial.io", "we" or "us" refers to an individual enterprise located in Germany.
The contact information of the owner of this enterprise can be found below.
2.
Third Parties On the Android and iOS app, we share your information with AdMob: https://policies.google.com/technologies/partner-sites The website doesn't use third parties.
3.
What information do we collect? Territorial.io collects and uses the following information from you: User IDs: A one-vs-one account with username, password and number of played games.
Emojis and flags: Which emojis and flags you send to other users.
App activity and gameplay: We collect app interactions that are necessary to process the game.
For example, we collect which countries you attack.
We also save the amount of seconds that you spend on a map.
Crash logs: We monitor JavaScript bugs and send them to our server.
IP addresses and device information: Our servers automatically collect IP addresses and device information (such as the name of your browser) and temporarily store them.
Third parties may use your IP address to examine your approximate location.
User product interactions: Third parties may collect user product interactions and interaction information, including app launch, taps, and video views.
Diagnostic information: Third parties may collect information related to the performance of the app and the SDK, including crash logs, app launch time, hang rate, and energy usage.
Device and Account identifiers: Third parties may collect device identifiers, such as the Android advertising (ad) ID, app set ID, and, if applicable, other identifiers related to signed-in accounts on the device.
On the website we collect cookies: If you need more information about our cookies, you may check out our cookie policy: https://territorial.io/cookie_policy 4.
How do we collect and use your information? We do not encrypt your information in transit.
We use your information to improve the game and to prevent fraud.
Furthermore, we process and store your information on our servers in Germany.
Error and bug reports help us to improve the game.
They do not contain personal information.
To make rated one-vs-one games possible, we collect account data such as usernames, passwords and ELO ratings.
Accounts are exposed to a daily ELO loss between 0.2 and 1.6 points.
Accounts with less than 0.1 ELO points will be permanently deleted.
Usernames and rankings are publicly available.
We show statistical and anonymous game data on Territorial.io (https://territorial.io/players and https://territorial.io/clans) and our Discord server (https://discord.gg/pa5TH6hZrv).
5.
How can you delete your information? You can ask us to delete your data at the email address shown below.
6.
Contact Information If you have more questions, please contact us at this email address: davidtschacher@gmail.com

documents.name: Cookie Policy
documents.text:
Cookie Policy Last Update: 5 August 2022 1.
General Information Territorial.io uses cookies to improve the user experience.
You can find out more about cookies in the sections below.
You don't have to accept cookies in order to play Territorial.io.
We recommend cookies as they will improve your gaming experience.
To understand how we use your information, you may also check out our privacy policy: https://territorial.io/privacy_policy 2.
What is a cookie? Cookies are small text files that are stored on your computer.
For example, a cookie can be used to remember your username.
3.
What types of cookies do we use? We use functionality cookies to store your preferences: -your username
-a boolean, indicating if your interface is magnified or not
-the password of your one-vs-one account
-the color of your country
-selected emojis Furthermore, we use a cookie that assigns a random number to your device.
4.
How do our servers handle cookies transmitted by users? We do not store and process cookies on our servers.
Cookies on the client side will be deleted after one year of inactivity.
Cookies will not be shared with third parties.
5.
More information about cookies If you want to know how to delete or manage cookies, the following links may be helpful: Cookie settings in Chrome and Android: https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647 Cookie settings in Firefox: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cookies-information-websites-store-on-your-computer Cookie settings in iOS: http://support.apple.com/kb/PH5042 If you need more information about cookies, you may check out this link: http://www.allaboutcookies.org/ 6.
Contact Information If you have more questions, please contact us at this email address: davidtschacher@gmail.com
